projects: [{"title":"Twitter sentiment analysis","start_date":"Jul 2019","end_date":"Present","description":"This is a project where natural language processing algorithm is used to divide the twitter statements about demonetization policy in good,positive,anger and different reviews. This is a very interesting project and I am doing it using python and scikit-learn inbuilt library."},{"title":"Recommendation engine for movie ratings.","start_date":"Jun 2019","description":"A recommendation engine is a powerful tool to predict customer demand and business growth. In this project recommendation engine for movies has been built using user history data and movie ratings given by users. Collaborative based filtering for the item to item and user to user similarity has been used as well as matrix factorization method has been used."},{"title":"Club Mahindra Challenge","start_date":"May 2019","description":"This was a data science challenge conducted by Club Mahindra through Analytics Vidhya. In this competition, the total amount spent on food for different resorts had to be predicted. I used the random forest to predict the response and I got a position on the leaderboard with RMSE of 111."},{"title":"Prediction of number of upvotes","start_date":"Jan 2019","end_date":"Present","description":"This is a machine learning challenge conducted by Analytics Vidhya in which the number of upvotes had to be predicted from queries asked in a website through a number of views, total answers are given and reputation score of the author giving an answer. I am able to get 14th rank among 950 participants"},{"title":"Time series analysis of daily female birth in California.","start_date":"Oct 2018","description":"Daily female birth of California has been forcasted and ARIMA model has been built.This was a part of exercise from practical time series analysis course of coursera."},{"title":"ZS associate competition","start_date":"Oct 2018","description":"This project was a challenge organised by ZS associate. Best soldier rank has to be predicted with respect to various features."},{"title":"Loan default prediction","start_date":"Jan 2018","description":"It was a loan default prediction problem organised by Analytics Vidhya. It was a binary classification problem. Logistic regression and other advanced machine learning algorithm such as random forest, XGboost, Navier's classifier etc are used for modelling and accuracy are compared."},{"title":"MNIST Fashion Image Classification of 10 classes with Convolution Neural Network with Keras framework (Deep Learning)","start_date":"Nov 2019","end_date":"Dec 2019","description":"Objective: To classify images of different pieces of clothing.Client & Data-Set: Fashion-MNIST is a dataset of Zalando's article images—consisting of a training set of 60,000 examples and a test set of 10,000 examples. Each example is a 28x28 grayscale image, associated with a label from 10 classes.Data-set is publicly available on kaggle and Zalando Fashion MNIST repository on Github.Fashion-MNIST is intended as direct drop-in replacement for the original MNIST dataset. It shares the same image size and structure of training and testing splits.Business Impact: E-commerce companies have lots of items for sale online which requires lots of images to be displayed on their websites, applications and on social media. And it takes lot of human power and time to separate these images into respective groups. This classifier which we are going to build helps businesses to categorize images into respective groups.Labels: Each training and test example is assigned to one of the following labels:• 0 - T-shirt/top • 1 - Trouser • 2 - Pullover • 3 - Dress • 4 - Coat • 5 - Sandal • 6 - Shirt • 7 - Sneaker • 8 - Bag • 9 - Ankle boot"},{"title":"Spam and Ham Classification","start_date":"Oct 2019","end_date":"Nov 2019","description":"This is a ham-spam classification problem in which ham and spam email texts are classified using Natural Language Processing. Random Forest is used for predictive modelling. Confusion matrix is used as an evaluation metric for accuracy assessment.The steps involved in NLP are:1. Data Cleaning and preprocessing 1.1. Case Normalization: Required some information that if upper case and lower case words are in same category or different. 1.2. Removing Stopwords: Stopwords are words that can be excluded from texts without loosing information such as I, Be, Because, Being,etc. 1.3. Removing Punctuation: Punctuations such as ',.,!,etc, has to be removed from texts. 1.4. Tokenization: It is done to seperate each words. 1.5. Stemming/Lemmatising: Both of these techniques reduce inflection forms to normalise words with the same lemma.he difference between lemmatising and stemming is that lemmatising performs this reduction by considering the context of the word while stemming does not.2. Vectorizing Data: Frequency of a particular word in the total document. TF-IDF is used for vectorizing. TF-IDF is term frequency is (no. of times term i is used in document)/(total number of terms in documents) and IDF is logarithm of TF and TF-IDF is TF*IDF. 2.1. Vectorizing data n-gram: combination of n alternate terms is called n grams.3. Feature Engineering New features are created such as length of text after removing white space and percentage of punctuation in total texts. Final predictive model is built with random forest."},{"title":"Time series analaysis of PM10","start_date":"May 2018","end_date":"May 2019","description":"This is my master's thesis in which I have built a time series model and predictive models to predict PM10 for Anand Vihar, New Delhi area. The autoregressive integrated moving average model was finalised as the best time series model and feed forward artificial neural network model was selected as the best predictive model."}]
